SENT.plain: Two patients who demonstrated skin lesions in the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies are documented
The first had a long history of recurrent painful nodules
She had also suffered two deep vein thromboses
The second developed a rash on the lower limbs resembling vasculitis which did not respond to prednisolone, but to low dose salicylate therapy
Histology in both patients revealed microthrombosis of cutaneous vessels
